etymologies: early 17th century: from medieval Latin horarius, from Latin hora ‘hour’

definitions: relating to hours as measurements of time

examples.text: the general horary arrangement of time

shortDefinitions: relating to hours as measurements of time

examples.text: I took horary observations of the barometer

definitions: relating to or denoting a branch of astrology in which answers are given to questions using a chart drawn up for the time a question is posed.
shortDefinitions: of branch of astrology in which answers are given to questions using chart drawn up for time question is posed
